Once you kill opposing SD's, your highly damaged SD's can be in the middle of the ocean but also be perfectly safe. That's why your Assassin SD's (A-SD) should be the vehicle of choice for finishing off damaged units or hunting down transports/subs/carriers. They're the only ones who can survive the aftermath.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]SD's should emphatically NOT be employed in a stack with other units, the way the AI does. It doesn't buy you anything, since SD's won't defend against anything except another SD.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Attack Submarine[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is a critical unit, because the AI really loves to use submarines to deliver tactical nukes. Once you have Stealth Destroyers, you'll need Attack Subs in order to help locate and destroy enemy submarines.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Because Attack Subs should only be used against other subs or transports/carriers or heavily damaged units, it's in the same category as a S-SD and should get Flanking and Sentry. Additional promotions should be Navigation 1 and 2.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Submarine[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]This is also a crucial unit because it's the way to deliver tactical nukes and additional cruise missiles to a front-deployed fleet. There's no combat role for the submarine because it's not powerful enough to fight any of the late-game opponents head on.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you want missile strikes - better to deliver it from a MC, which can follow up with an attack or survive a counter-attack after getting close to enemy shores.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you want to detect/kill other subs, the Attack Sub is much better.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That's why the main role of subs is to either shuttle cruise missiles to re-load MC's which have fired their on-board supply or to sneak in a tactical nuke. As such, submarines receive Flanking and Navigation 1/2. Beyond that, add Sentry to help avoid threats.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Battleship[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Whatever battleships you have as of the time that MC's come along - leave them alone. There's no need to spend money upgrading BB's when they don't gain any combat power and the supply of cruise missiles always tend to trail the number of MC's on hand.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Instead, use the BB's for the same role as they had in CIV4 original - escorting carriers and transports. Their MP's are perfect, once the transport/carrier has been upgraded with Navigation 1. They're just as powerful in defensive role as MC's.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There's no particular need to stock up on BB's, and also no reason to change how you use them from the original CIV4. You can't see SD's or subs sneaking up on you, but that's why you have surveillance SD's and Attack Subs anyways.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Destroyers[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These are critical units which should be stockpiled in large numbers. Build them while you can and NEVER upgrade them. You can always build more SD's, but the supply of destroyers you have are finite[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]DD's have the ability to detect subs, they can move farther than the Attack Subs, and can kill the invading subs just as effectively. On top of that, they still retain their anti-air capabilities, so they're not nearly as vulnerable to air assault as the submarines.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]DD's also come in the same 2 varieties as SD's - surveillance or attack. Unlike SD's, surveillance-type DD's should be used to escort large fleets because it'll provide some redundant sub-spotting (and killing) capability.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Otherwise, attack- and surveillance-DD's should be deployed near shorelines because they're so valuable and so vulnerable.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Carriers[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In theory, carriers are much less useful than before. Air recon can't detect submarines or Stealth Destroyers, and the naval strike role which made Jet fighters valuable can now be taken over by missiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In reality, carriers are still useful for providing first-strike on detected submarines and MC's which have been stripped of their escorts. More importantly, they have a HUGE role in one of the main purposes of the navy - supporting a beachhead.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forts[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Technically not an unit, but so crucial it deserves its own mention. With BTS, fortifications act as cities for naval and air purposes. That means new tricks which were impossible before.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A naval unit can use a fort to create a land-bridge to cross an island while an enemy fleet must take the long way around. A ship can move from ocean-to-fort #1, then fort #1-to-city, then city-to-fort #2, and finally fort #2 to ocean. A crossing which might have used on the entire MP quota of a MC could instead be completed with only 4 MP's.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ocean-Fort-City-Fort-Ocean[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A fort can also be constructed to give you secure naval bases in stretches of your territory where it makes no sense to plant a city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A fort can be used to house fighters/bombers to help support your coastal defense.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Now, if you're lucky enough to have an island off your shore, build a city on it just to be able to use it as forward air/naval station. Forts give you shortcuts to help chase down a faster enemy, and a secure way of bringing your transports further along before exposing them to attack.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Naval deployments[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There are several major categories of naval war strategy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can choose to fight a defensive action, where your fleets are deployed out of home ports and are tasked with killing any unit you see. The goal is to protect your own lands while the land war continues or you're trying to prevent a landing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There's also the offensive approach, where you bring your fleets near the enemy cities to offer battle and to strike at their infrastructure. The goal is to decimate their coastal cities and wipe out their fleet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Finally, there's the sea-lane action where the goal is to maintain a secure travel route in order to ship in more units for the war in a distant location.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In reality, a large war will always involve at least some of each of the 3 in different phases. It might start with a defensive action, then you'd move to secure a sea lane to provide an invasion corridor, and finally shift over to a total offensive action.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Or it might be the other way around, where you deploy your fleet to a forward position to nail the initial stack-of-doom invasion fleet and then pull back to a defensive position shortly afterwards.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In all cases, there are some basic tactics to consider.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Oceanic Surveillance[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With the Stealth Destroyer, it's critical that you cover the ocean with your own Surveillance-SD's. Each S-SD can cover 14 ocean squares, so it doesn't take that many units. Because enemy SD's can easily move beyond the range of your S-SD in a single turn, you need to either deploy enough units to cover the ENTIRE ocean or establish two picket lines far enough apart that there's no way that an enemy unit can get past your S-SD's.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Between the S-SD pickets, you should seed in Attack Subs, also spaced out carefully to make sure there are no gaps. That's the only way you're going to spot the enemy subs given the disability of the S-SD's.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In combination, the line should look like[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]S [BOLD](enemy continent)[\BOLD] N[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]--SD----SD----SD----SD----SD-- [BOLD](SD line 2)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]AS----AS----AS----AS----AS-- [BOLD](AS line 2)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE]--SD----SD----SD----SD----SD-- [BOLD](SD line 1)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]AS----AS----AS----AS----AS-- [BOLD](AS line 1)[\BOLD][NEWLINE]+[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]S [BOLD](home continent)[\BOLD] N[NEWLINE][NEWLINE](each [COLOR_RED]+[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_RED]-[COLOR_REVERT] represents an empty ocean square)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The combined 9 spaces between the SD lines means that it's impossible for enemy SD's to slip by, and the double-line of attack subs also ensure that no submarine can make it past without being stuck in at least 1 location where your own Attack Submarine can see it. The absence of an Attack Sub is also a clue that there must be at least 1 enemy sub in the vicinity, so units in the 1st line should be prepared to move up to the next line at any time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The goal is to NOT use the units in the line to make attacks and to place your own battle fleet in a position to attack only after detection of the enemy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Attack echelon[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When attacking an enemy fleet, always check if there's SD's in the stack. If there is, send your own attack-configured Stealth Destroyers in first to engage them. Beyond that, use cruise missiles to soften up the enemy units to around 30 strength, and then send in your highest promoted MC which has Barrage. That MC will probably die, but naval warfare is about attrition - not experience. It'll soften up the fleet for follow up attacks. Then send in additional MC's until there are no units above strength ~20.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At this point, it's time for the assassin SD's to enter the fray and clean up. By holding back promotions, the same group of SD's can be used to attack multiple fleets over time and they're perfectly safe sitting in the middle of the ocean as long as you eliminate enemy SD's.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Forts and airpower[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Airpower is less powerful now that nearly 1/2 of the modern AI navy can't be detected by recon, but that's why you deployed that Oceanic Surveillance network. Forts give you places to put Stealth Bombers where it can do the most good, and add to the numbers of deployed aircraft. Do NOT send in stealth bombers until the enemy jet fighters are eliminated, but they can be deadly against subs and missile cruisers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Each fort should come standard with at least 1 A-SD and 1 S-DD, to provide full coastal surveillance. Then drop in a gunpowder unit with Medic to provide healing and cover against amphibian assault.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Carrier airpower[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Given the danger of parking a carrier in the middle of the ocean, and how softening up the enemy fleet can be done via cruise missiles - there isn't much of a role for carriers as before. Their job is now more specialized.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Carriers should also be based in forts/frontier port cities. They can sally out 4 squares, launch air strikes, and then retreat. Rather than trying to avoid the enemy fighters, you're going AFTER them. Strike directly at the enemy carriers, and whittle down their fighters to open them up for stealth bomber strikes. That covers everything between line #1 and #2 on your surveillance net.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You can then reload with fighters from a secure home port during the same turn, and be ready to sally forth again.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In the assault role, carriers are a lifesaver. When an enemy city is taken, it's never taken with the airport intact so the amount of airpower available is limited. There's also no option to use nearby cities to provide extra air cover if this is the beachhead. Support the ocean crossing with carriers, and you can park as many fighters in the conquered city as you want. Then every available slot can be used for Stealth Bombers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Submarine shuttle[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Unless you plan to use tactical nukes, regular submarines are mainly useful in finding other subs and bringing cruise missiles to bear. Like regular land units in transports, missiles can be transferred from subs to MC's. That will help fleets to keep a full inventory of cruise missiles without coming off their forward-deployed stations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Since the surveillance pickets are keeping an eye open for any intruding units, the submarine carrying missiles to the front should have a secure journey, doubly so if the MC move back enough spaces to shorten the journey.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Convoy Escort[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When escorting convoys, you need a BIG fleet unless your sea superiority is so complete that the AI navy is completely decimated. But given production advantages, that's unlikely. In general, a convoy's escorting fleet units should reflect how many turns the fleet will be in transit.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]MC's = (# turns) x3[NEWLINE]SD's = (# turns) x2[NEWLINE]DD's = (# turns) x1[NEWLINE]Carriers = 3 minimum[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]That's a lot of ships but you should need 1 escort fleet per ocean and you can use it to escort 4 or 25 transports.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]I consider the "typical" crossing to be 3 turns, landing the army on the 3rd turn. That means a fleet of 9 MC's, 6 SD's, 3 DD's and 3 carriers.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]At the start of the turn, move the carriers forward 2 spaces and send out 2 fighters to recon for large fleets. That will make sure you detect any large stacks of BB's or MC's for a detour if necessary. Next, send the DD's on a roundabout route to the targeted rendezvous point. With S-DD's, you should be able to scan a 6-square wide corridor and still get the DD's to the target point. Any detected subs will be struck by air power. SD's with cruise missiles and subs with air strikes. Move your A-SD's in for the kill and then have them rejoin the fleet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As the final move of the turn, the rest of the fleet (MC, carrier, and transports) will move to the convoy station through a thoroughly sanitized area so that the AI won't know for sure you have transports coming their way. Remember that the AI's LOVE Espionage so they already know your port of embarkation. They just don't know when the transports will sail. But they will know once your transports leave port, so it's important to deny the AI precise location on your transports.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Final point - the transports should hold off-shore the planned insertion point as far as possible on the final move to keep out of range of land-based air and units which might sally forth from secure ports. That means even if you have the MP's to gt within 4 squares of the coast on that turn, hold off 6-7 squares so that the transport can make a last-turn dash straight for the enemy coast.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Coastline defense[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With cruise missiles, stealth destroyers, and air strikes - defending off-shore platforms and fishing boats are just a quick way to get your units killed. Stockpile the work boats and leave those resources unguarded. A good surveillance network will protect your off-shore resources more surely than a bunch of sentry-duty MC's or SD's.

[H1]Space Exploration Guide[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1]- by [BOLD]Ruevan[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The international mod Caveman2Cosmos, as the name implies, is a simulator of civilization at all stages its development from the life of cavemen to space expansion. As a translator who has studied many guidebooks and strategies from developers and third-party authors, I was surprised to notice the almost complete absence of guides for space exploration, while there are more than enough of them for ancient times. Meanwhile, space expansion takes up the entire second half of the game, only 6 eras! For beginners, this topic may seem like a rather confusing part of the gameplay, since nothing like this was provided in the original Civ4 BtS. This prompted me to write and integrate this guide and tutorial for beginner players and inexperienced civilizers into Civilopedia.[PARAGRAPH:1][TAB]Before going directly to the main topic, there are a few basic points that need to be clarified. Initially, Civilization4 was not conceived for such modifications as C2C, and its engine was outdated long before the appearance of this mod. When developing C2C, modders, of course, intended to bring the development of galactic spaces into the gameplay. But here's the catch: how can this be done in practice? At one time, Sid Meier, the father of the Civilization game series, released several additions on the conquest of the Alpha Centauri system. Basically, it was just an independent scenario on a separate map. By default, players started the game with a ready-made set of technologies of the future and the corresponding buildings, resources and units. However, the very idea of ​​the Caveman2Cosmos mod implies development from stone axes to starships, i.e. start on the mortal Earth, and only then make a leap from it to other worlds. What, then, to do? The outdated engine of the fourth Civilization does not allow you to play on two or more maps, nor to export save and player profiles to other scenarios. And the developers of the mod have found a truly Solomon solution: to create a set of huge maps, divided into many sections - the Earth, near space, the Moon, the planets of the Solar System, deep space, the Milky Way, the Local Cluster and further down to the outskirts of the visible Universe. Until all players have evolved to space technology, they cannot leave the starting earth sector. They are not even able to see anything beyond the “end of the earth. Then, as technology develops, it becomes possible to explore and master first the immediate surroundings of the home planet, then go deeper and deeper into space. This will be discussed below, but for now we note how elegantly the developers of this mod were able to get out of the situation, bypassing the limitations of the engine.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](1) What is needed for space expansion?[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]First of all, you should get a selection of high-quality space maps. The characteristics you want are a huge size, which can accommodate 20-24 players, the presence of all sections and terrain types provided in the mod, and the resources corresponding to them. Before starting the game, you should turn off all easily achievable types of victory, such as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Cultural[COLOR_REVERT] - otherwise the game will end before you launch the first artificial satellite. The best maps, relevant to all the latest versions of the mod, can be found from the C2C developers on their forum at "civfanatics.com". The included scenarios from [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Snofru[COLOR_REVERT], I think, meet almost all the stated criteria. The optimal game speed for this would be "Marathon" and, I suppose, "Snail", but the final choice is always up to the player.[PARAGRAPH:1]So, you have decided on the map, chosen a civilization to your liking, established a set of rules for the game and embarked upon it. You will start the game in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Prehistoric Era[COLOR_REVERT], as usual, surrounded by familiar forests and steppes on the virgin Earth. Long hundreds and thousands of moves you will not be occupied with the problem of space exploration. The first six eras, from [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stone Age[COLOR_REVERT] to the end of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Industrial Age[COLOR_REVERT], you will develop in the usual mode for civilizers: scout the neighborhood, fight for access to resources, fight, trade, build new cities. The turning point will come when you fully evolve and enter the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nuclear Age[COLOR_REVERT], where you can explore a group of core technologies that will give you the opportunity to take your first tentative steps beyond your home planet - while still in near-Earth space. This will be discussed in one of the sections further down the text of the manual.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](2) Information about the game eras.[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]As we know, only in actual Caveman2Cosmos versions provide as many as 13 eras and over 942 technologies in the research tree. It is hard to disagree that this presupposes a very long game. Each era is characterized by its own gameplay features. Thus, in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Prehistoric Era[COLOR_REVERT], players have one small settlement and most of their time is spent hunting various game and domesticating animals. Further, starting from the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Era of the Ancient World[COLOR_REVERT] up to the middle [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Information Age[COLOR_REVERT], the game is similar to the classic Civ4 BtS. Finally, the last 5-6 epochs you will devote the lion's share of your time to exploration of more and more new sectors of the space part of the map and their gradual development. The gameplay will more and more resemble what was Alpha Centauri and similar additions. What characterizes each era in the second half of the game, in short? To do this, let us give the floor to one of the developers, who was engaged in the "space component" of C2C.[PARAGRAPH:1]Here is what [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT] writes about the epochs of interest to us, namely, Nuclear, Information, Nanotech, Transhumanistic, Galactic, Cosmic and Transcendental: “The nuclear age is the stage from which the cosmic age begins. The era runs from roughly 1914 to 1989, from World War I to the end of the Cold War. Technically, the space age begins when you explore satellites. By the end of this era, as the developers point out, you are evolving to the first space stations and exploration of the immediate vicinity of the Earth. Further, [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT] points out, "The Information Age" roughly corresponds to the periods 1990 to 2050 ... You will receive your first interplanetary unit, the Interplanetary Probe ... at the beginning of the Information Age. Interplanetary probes can carry out initial exploration of Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune ... You can explore asteroid surfaces and Kuiper belt objects, the Inner Solar System, Outer Solar System, Titan and Europa, as well as objects in Trans-Neptunian space. .. At this stage, the player can only reconnoiter the vicinity of the solar system, send probes and interplanetary stations, build outposts and temporary bases on the lunar surface, but nothing more. During this period, there is still no talk of full-fledged colonization of other worlds.[PARAGRAPH:1]More serious space exploration comes only from the 9th game era - [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanotech[COLOR_REVERT]. “The era of nanotechnology is the period when the true colonization of space begins. Not only intelligence missions and a few lonely outposts, but real cities. During this era, you will colonize four sectors: lunar space, the Moon, Mars and Venus. In the end, you will need all four, the developers of the mod explain. Rather, these will be small resource-producing colonies that will only eventually grow into full-fledged cities. At this stage, however, you will need not only lunar or Martian ores, but also bonuses from space buildings. And you can rest assured that they provide powerful boosts to income from trade in the future and to scientific research now. Their initial high cost and inefficiency will later pay off a hundredfold as the population of the extraterrestrial colony grows.[PARAGRAPH:1]In the next 10th era, you will lay the first bricks in the foundation of the future interstellar empire. The transhuman era is characterized by extensive colonization of the outer solar system, as well as significant biological and cybernetic transformation of the population, notes [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT]. It is at this stage that tiny settlements on the Moon and Mars turn into rich metropolises, protected by domes and artificial magneto from ionizing radiation. Between the planets, the movement of the first caravans of cargo ships has been adjusted, and the first combat stations and laser batteries are on duty in orbit to guard the order in orbit. Lunar and Martian factories produce unique goods and products, exotic vegetables and fruits grow in hydroponic greenhouses, and trade routes between the Earth, the Moon and Mars are expanding and multiplying. But this is not the main thing in this era. Beginning with the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Transhuman Era[COLOR_REVERT], you begin to move more confidently and further towards the edge of the solar system. First, you send magnetic sailboats and work drones to build the first outposts in the vicinity of the giant planets and their moons, then the first colonists will arrive there. You can not only mine methane, deuterium or helium-2 in these worlds, but also equip military bases, spaceports, interstellar beacons and communication centers, research bases, build hangars and factories. It is the distant planets, like Neptune and Pluto, that will later become the springboard from which you will first step beyond the edge of the solar system and further into the vastness of the Galaxy. As the developers write: “By the end of the transhuman era, your civilization is approaching Type II on the Kardashev scale. Although much of the era is based on established physics, engineering and sociology are becoming much more speculative than in the past.”[PARAGRAPH:1]Then you enter the operational space of the vast expanses of the Milky Way. As you discover new technologies, you expand your ability to colonize other star systems. "As the name suggests", explains [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT], "in the Galactic Era, you transcend the solar system and colonize the Milky Way galaxy". As before, you first send out reconnaissance probes to different worlds, then you send the first colonists, and towards the end of the era you create a general galaxy economy and an extensive system of interstellar trade. It is incomparably larger than what was in the previous era in the solar system. Also in this era there is a chip that was not found in previous technological eras. Her name is terraforming. With the study of the necessary set of technologies, your working drones and astro engineers will be able to transform lifeless stones and other inhospitable worlds into heavenly planets suitable for a comfortable life and prosperity for your colonists. Finally, you will live to see the first contact with alien civilizations, however, at the current stage, this is displayed in the gameplay so far in the form of new cultures and related bonuses. "Star Wars" should be expected in future updates of the C2C mod, and for the time being you will have to compete for power over the galaxy with the Aztecs, Romans and Persians familiar to you. "In the Galactic era, you are moving from transhumanism to direct posthumanism," the developers write. - “By the end of the era, you have populated most of the galaxy and are on the right path to becoming a Type III civilization on the Kardashev scale.”[PARAGRAPH:1]The last two eras, [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Space[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Transcendental[COLOR_REVERT], as their name suggests, implies the sequential exploration of neighboring galaxies and star clusters in the same way and exponentially as in the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Galactic era[COLOR_REVERT], but on a larger scale. In addition to terraforming asteroids, planets and their moons, founding cities on exoplanets and building space stations and bases, you will get the opportunity to create new celestial bodies to your liking. Also at this stage, you can build various bizarre astro-engineering structures, such as toroidal planets and the "Alderson Disc". In addition, you will gradually master not only space, but also time. In these eras there are technologies with which you can create time loops and pocket worlds, cities of the distant past and the future, portals and wormholes in hyperspace, master all 11 dimensions, build an alternative reality, all kinds of "spiritual kingdoms", create intelligent stars and a "brain Boltzmann ”and many other strange things. “In a reprogrammed reality, you can build a multiverse economy that correlates with a civilization close to Type V on the Kardashev scale. This allows you to build some of the greatest wonders and progress as much as possible, ”summarizes and summarizes the above [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT] on his speculative journey into the distant future.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](3) First steps.[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Everything mentioned in the section above, by and large, is a matter of distant times. In this guide, we will not consider in detail such a distant future and talk about how to better light the stars, bend space and collide black holes. Before attempting this, you must first get used to your native solar system, at least on the moon. Unaccustomed, many newcomers stumble upon this very first preparatory stage of space colonization. Let's try in this section to figure out what a player can and cannot do in the middle of a game after the first satellite launched. [PARAGRAPH:1] So, you have already reached [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nuclear era[COLOR_REVERT] and studied all the necessary technologies for launch of the first Sputnik. At this stage, you are taking the first steps in space exploration and there is still little you can do. The first space unit available to you is [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Satellite[COLOR_REVERT]. So far, only the Earth sector and the near-earth orbit are available to him. With its help, you can scout the "fog of war" surrounding your home planet and an approximate path to the moon. But the main benefit of it is different. With this unit, you can complete the Satellite Launch mission as soon as you enter orbit. In return, you will receive a special reward unit in your capital: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mining[COLOR_REVERT] (low earth orbit). This reward can be spent on various bonuses: a large amount of gold, accelerating research, increasing the rating of your civilization in general statistics, and much more. You can get such reward units whenever you complete a mission to any uncharted sector of space, or the surface of an asteroid or another planet. Some rewards can be exchanged for unique buildings or Wonders. All this should stimulate the player to equip more expeditions and send more interplanetary probes, accelerating his development. In this case, the satellite will be the first such scout. There are some similarities between this process and hunting at the beginning of the game. The difference is that in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Stone Age[COLOR_REVERT] you obtained food for the accelerated growth of settlements and domesticated animals through hunting trophies, and this time your goal is not population growth and food, but scientific progress.[PARAGRAPH:1]Towards the end of the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nuclear Age[COLOR_REVERT], you will explore the technologies [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Space Stations[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Lunar Exploration[COLOR_REVERT]. The first discovery will give you access to three Wonders to speed up your exploration, as well as build a reusable [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Space Shuttle[COLOR_REVERT]. More importantly, from now on you can build the 1st level of the space station. This is a very important preparatory stage in the future exploration of the Moon, so it is worth taking it seriously. The second technology will allow you to create [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Moon Rovers[COLOR_REVERT]. With their help, you can not only scout the surface of the Moon, but also complete a special mission in exchange for three Wonders of the World of your choice. Needless to say, what advantage over rivals will get the winner in the lunar race already at this initial stage?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](4) Outposts and their meaning.[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]The nuclear age has ended and a new [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Information Age has begun[COLOR_REVERT]. You still cannot colonize the Moon or Mars yet. Most of your activities in this era will focus mainly on three areas: exploration of the vicinity of the planets of the solar system with automatic stations and probes, the race for space wonders and the construction of orbital stations (hereinafter: OS). Success for completing missions promises you an increase in scientific research, and without the development of the space station to level 3, you will not be able to create the first settlers in the next era that can cost cities on the moon. So, the task is clear, now we will understand the details of how best to achieve success. Already in the previous era, you could launch [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Space Shuttles[COLOR_REVERT]. In this era, they will play the role of a transporter to supply your OS. By sending the first shuttle to the station, you can improve its level by one point. Thus, to reach the 3rd level of the station, you only need to send two shuttles and learn two technologies: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Space tourism[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Asteroid mining[COLOR_REVERT]. The last discovery will not happen soon, because is in the last third of the era, so before that it makes sense to concentrate on exploring planets and completing quests for rewards. First you need to open Science [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Planetary Exploration[COLOR_REVERT] to access the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Interplanetary Probes[COLOR_REVERT]. These scouts must be sent to the orbits of Mars, Venus, Mercury, giant planets and their satellites for reward units and access to unique Wonders, such as Voyager Mission, Mariner, Cassini-Huygens, and other highly coveted rewards. In the same way, a little later, you can explore the trans-Neptunian space with your list of useful buns.[PARAGRAPH:1]Our next goal is three technologies: [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Solar pulse[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Space tourism[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Commercial space exploration[COLOR_REVERT]. The first science will give us access to the unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Solar sailboat[COLOR_REVERT] - the first worker able to build improvements right in space, like star beacons and asteroid mines. The second discovery will give us the opportunity to improve the OS to level 2, and the third science allows us to create [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Heavy rockets[COLOR_REVERT], without which you simply cannot really explore the Moon and develop the primary infrastructure. Your next task is to capture a couple of asteroids and tow them to the lunar orbit. To do this, we use solar sailing ships to get the Captured Asteroid special unit, and send it closer to future space settlements in lunar orbit. Now you can order workers to build an asteroid mine and an upgrade of the same name in the first space city in lunar orbit. But this is yet to come, but for now let's see what can be done on the surface of the Moon itself.[PARAGRAPH:1]You cannot yet populate the Moon, but it is already possible to lay the first outposts, temporary bases and outposts on its surface. How is this done in practice? First you need to research technology [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Lunar bases[COLOR_REVERT]. This will give us two things: Unit [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Building Module[COLOR_REVERT] and the Lunar Base, Lunar Outpost and Lunar Mountain Outpost terrain improvements. None of these improvements will give you immediate income or rewards at this stage, but in the next era, when the first colonists land on the moon, there will be almost ready infrastructure on its surface. The bases or "Lunar residential complexes" are especially important to us. They paint the cell of the lunar surface they occupy in the colors of your civilization. [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Attention:[COLOR_REVERT] future colonists cannot just take and build a city on the Moon on an empty and undeveloped cell. They definitely need prebuilt bases or outposts, and the terrain should already be under your [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]cultural influence[COLOR_REVERT]. This means that in the next era, the advantage in the colonization of the Moon will be gained by the civilization that has already taken care of and “staked out” the most convenient and tasty areas of our heavenly neighbor. Take this into account and do not miss an important moment in this intermediate stage of space exploration, do not give up the initiative to competitors! Let's summarize the above. You need to have time to study all the necessary technologies before your rivals and send probes to different planets for rewards and bonuses. You need to build a couple of OS near the Earth and in the lunar orbit during the epoch and improve them to level 3. You need to capture at least two asteroids and exchange them for the corresponding buildings. Finally, you need to get ahead of other civilizations and be the first to rebuild bases and outposts on the lunar surface and send heavy rockets to the moon in advance. You will need them in the next era - more details will be covered in the next section.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](5) Colonization of the solar system.[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB] Finally, you have reached the 9th game era or [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanotech[COLOR_REVERT]. It is from this moment that you can fully inhabit the Moon, Mars and partly - Venus. Likewise, in the next era [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tranghumanism[COLOR_REVERT], you will build cities on the satellites of the giant planets and in the Kuiper Belt on the outskirts of the solar system in the same way. For now, let's focus on how this works in the gameplay at the initial stage. This is where many players stumble, wondering why they cannot build the first city on the moon and what is required for this. The guide below is intended to help you deal with this problem.[PARAGRAPH:1]First you need to learn the technology [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Advanced Ecosystems[COLOR_REVERT], which will open access to the creation of the first [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lunar settlers[COLOR_REVERT] and a bunch of buildings on the lunar orbit. First you need a heavy rocket. Fly on it to the space station of the 3rd level that you have built in advance. Now, it turns out, a new mission is available to you: the upgrade to the "Lunar settler"! Now we take this settler and fly to any site you like in lunar orbit and build your first city there. Note: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lunar settler[COLOR_REVERT] can only build cities in the orbit of the Moon, not on its surface. You will get this opportunity a little later. Having opened the construction panel in your first extraterrestrial city, you will find that there is not a single earthly building in the general list (except for temples and cathedrals), but there are many new buildings that are inaccessible on Earth, such as the Orbital Prison, Zero Gravity Arena "," Airgel Shields "and" Orbital Telescope ". The latter gives you 800 to 1500 [ICON_RESEARCH] for scientific research. In general, for the future: many space, lunar, Martian and alien buildings provide significantly greater bonuses than any terrestrial structures. They provide a significant boost to your scientific research. The more you build in space, the faster you learn more and more new technologies in the late game. This is extremely important, because if you lag behind your competitors in science, then in the future it will only gain a foothold, which is fraught with your defeat in the party. Civilizations isolated on Earth that never made it into space will be erased by more agile rivals.[PARAGRAPH:1]The following important technologies are [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Moon Colonization[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Lunar Tourism[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Lunar Tourism industry[COLOR_REVERT]. The first will give you the ability to create [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lunar colonists[COLOR_REVERT], and a lot of lunar structures. The second technology will make your colonies highly profitable, not unprofitable, as before. Finally, the third technology, as the name suggests, will give you the opportunity to build factories, mines and processing complexes on the Moon, as well as the first lunar units: an infantryman and a working combine for laying routes and digging mines. After researching Colonization of the Moon, send your Heavy Missile to the Lunar Tier 3 OX where you need to upgrade it to [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Lunar Colonist[COLOR_REVERT]. Unlike the settler, the colonist can move on the lunar surface, so we send the latter to the destination. Remember the advice above about the need to stake out a territory on the Moon in advance? Now is the time to settle down. Send a colonist to any square with a rebuilt outpost or residential complex - the site should be painted in the colors of your civilization. As soon as you reach the desired cell, the colonist will have a new command "Build a city". Click on this button - congratulations on the first successfully founded city on the moon![PARAGRAPH:1]However, when you open the panel for building a new city, you realize that it is practically empty, unprofitable and hardly growing. To solve this problem, build those cheap buildings "Solar Panels", "Lunar Depot", "Lunar Cistern" and "Fertilizer Storage" ... The first will give you electricity, and the last three will provide you with some resources and food. Then you build a quarry nearby, a concrete mixer, a glass factory - all this will give you access to greenhouses and greenhouses, which in turn will supply food to the colonists. Then, use the construction ship to assemble the first worker harvester and connect your first city to the surrounding mines and quarries with a grid of dirt roads. Later, you will connect the first lunar city with the following in the same way.[PARAGRAPH:1]Having settled properly on the moon, it is time to turn your eyes to other worlds. We are of course interested in Mars and Venus. For this we need planetary colonization technologies, especially [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alien Mining[COLOR_REVERT]. At this stage of technological development, you should already have available a new type of colonist - [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Planetary settler[COLOR_REVERT]. You can get it again - by upgrading a heavy rocket to it on the 3rd level OS. Unlike its lunar counterpart, it can build cities on the Venusian and Martian surfaces. Where is it preferable to fly, to Venus or Mars? In this era, relatively few Venusian buildings and upgrades are available to you, although you can already create Venusian workers and colonists by researching [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Supersonic Rail[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Alien Industry[COLOR_REVERT], respectively. Settlements on Venus before the era of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Tranghumanism[COLOR_REVERT] will grow very slowly, which is not surprising for such a hellishly hot planet with a dense poisonous atmosphere. Nevertheless, I would recommend that you establish a couple of settlements on Venus already at this stage in order to stake out the best territories. The main target after the Moon for us will be Mars. Its colonization takes place almost in the same way as the Moon: you create a planetary settler on the OS and send him to the Red Planet. I recommend placing the first city in a place with the greatest concentration of resources, such as [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Martian Blueberry[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Dry Ice[COLOR_REVERT], so that the city radius covers approximately equal number of plain and hilly cells. In fact, the first Martian city will be your resource base. By the time your first city on Mars grows, you will have built the first spaceport in lunar orbit. From this time on, you can already create planetary settlers directly, bypassing the stage of sending a heavy rocket from Earth to the Moon. This will significantly speed up your expansion. For a start, 2-3 cities on Mars will be enough for you, but later it is advisable to increase them to six, because at the end of the next epoch you will need 6 specific Martian buildings to access a special Wonder - "The Economy of the Solar System". In the future, cities on Venus and Mars will themselves be able to equip settlers, workers and soldiers to guard your bases. With the study of technology [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Androids[COLOR_REVERT] you will be able to create special workers for the moon. They, like the Martian and Venusian workers, know how, unlike combines, build lines for maglev trains and connect cities with each other and with deposits of valuable resources. Solar panels outside the cities will give you [ICON_PRODUCTION] and [ICON_GOLD], and greenhouses will provide colonists with food supplies. Back in the era of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanotech[COLOR_REVERT], after researching the appropriate technology, you can build more advanced versions of solar sailing ships that can operate in remote corners of the solar system. You will need them in the next era, when you will settle down in the vicinity of the giant planets and in the orbit of Pluto.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](6) Development synergy.[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]After AD [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanotech[COLOR_REVERT] should be four era of technological development: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]transhumanist[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Galactic[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Space[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Transcendental[COLOR_REVERT]. Each of these future eras is characterized by the exponential development of your civilization from single-planetary to multi-planetary, with the consistent development of the entire solar system, then the Milky Way galaxy, neighboring galaxies and, finally, the entire Multiverse. We will not dwell on these epochs in detail in the current analysis, since the exploration of the Galaxy follows the same algorithms as the Moon, Mars and the distant planets of the Solar System (although they have their own small nuances). First, you study technologies that give access to more and more advanced versions of reconnaissance probes and resettlement starships, then you scout the distant sectors of space, send the first colonists, found the first cities, connect them to each other until they unite into a single galactic commercial and industrial empire. In this guide, we have shown how, step by step, you can evolve beyond the Earth and populate other planets. However, these are insufficient conditions for further expansion beyond the solar system. Until you economically combine the disparate economy of each colony and planet into a single system, you will not be able to move on. It was so conceived by the modders that only mega-civilization, which combines the economic potential of the Earth, Moon, Venus, Mars and other planets, will have enough strength and resources to colonize the same Alpha Centauri. This has been implemented in the game in the form of so-called special Wonders, available at the end of each of the last five eras, starting with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nanotech[COLOR_REVERT]. These special Minor Wonders are: Lunar Economy, Solar System Economy, Galactic Economy, Metagalactic Economy, and Universe Economy. Without building at least one of the listed Wonders, you will not be able to effectively master the following sectors of space in the future and will be stuck at the current stage of development. For understanding, we will give only one illustrative example: the "Lunar Economy" provides access to orbital megastructures, like the "O'Neill Cylinder". These buildings can be constructed both in lunar orbit and in the Kuiper Belt region during the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Transhuman[COLOR_REVERT] era. In turn, without the "O'Neill Cylinders" it is impossible to construct a whole branch of buildings, with the help of which one can equip interstellar probes and immigrant starships and go out into the galactic expanses. Thus, without the "Lunar Economy" and the "Economy of the Solar System" you will not be able to advance beyond the Kuiper Belt, and without the "Galactic Economy" you are ordered a road to the Andromeda Nebula and other distant sectors. This makes colonization more difficult, but makes the gameplay more interesting and deep. The importance of these Lesser Wonders cannot be overstated. Let's try to use the example of the "Lunar Economy" to figure out what is needed for their construction and what it gives in general.[PARAGRAPH:1]The "Lunar Economy" and the other 4 similar Small Wonders require a whole group of buildings, some of which must be built on Earth , and the rest - in the lunar orbit and the Moon itself. Failure to fulfill at least one item from the general list makes this Miracle inaccessible for construction. This rule works for all five Wonders - only the requirements for each specific one differ. Details should be found in the corresponding article in the Civilopedia, but for now let's figure it out with the basis, taking the "Lunar Economy" as an example. Here's what you need to build and have in order to access this special Wonder:[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Orbital Factory (2);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Cargo Spaceport (4);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Orbital Power Station (6);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Commercial Spaceport (11);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Asteroid Mine (2);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Magnetic ramp (4 pcs.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Near-moon colony (6 pcs.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Moon base (6 pcs.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Lunar spaceport (2);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Lunar assembly shop (2)[PARAGRAPH:1]Along with the buildings listed above, you will need to research the technology [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Trade with the Moon[COLOR_REVERT] at the very end of the nanotechnology era and acquire the following items: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Photonic Panels[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Exoskeletons[COLOR_REVERT] and [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Metamaterials[COLOR_REVERT]. This Miracle is being built on Earth, contrary to its name. Now let's figure out the numbers above, opposite the name of each building. They represent the total amount your civilization needs to build. For example, you need eleven commercial spaceports, one for each city. This means something else: you need at least six cities on the moon and the same number in lunar orbit, since this is exactly how many "Lunar bases" and "Near-moon colonies" are required. You already understand the scale of the work, don't you? There may be a hitch with asteroid mines, because the necessary cells with asteroids may not be in the lunar orbit. In this case, you will have to capture and tow a couple of space cobblestones using solar sailing ships, which was already discussed in the 4th paragraph "Outposts and their meaning". As soon as all the requirements from the list are met, you can start building the Wonder. Upon completion, a special building effect will appear in each of your cities. It will unlock the construction of the following buildings in the next era: "The Eye of Heaven" and "O'Neill's Cylinder", which gives rise to a line of one and a half dozen buildings needed to colonize the Milky Way, as mentioned above.[PARAGRAPH:1]Exactly like this. The remaining four special Wonders are built on the same principle in subsequent eras. It is important to carefully study the list of requirements in the Civilopedia and prepare the corresponding buildings or resources ahead of time. Then obtaining these Miracles and their associated effects will not be too difficult and super-effort for you.[PARAGRAPH:2]On this note, I conclude my review article on the basics of space colonization. Special thanks to [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT] and the rest of the developers of this great Civilization IV mod, as well as everyone who contributed to the development of this project and its community. I hope that this guide will help newcomers to get used to the tangled wilds of mod and space expansion and end up with an exciting and comfortable game.
TEXT.Russian: [H1]Руководство по освоению космоса[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1]- составитель [BOLD]Ruevan[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Глобальный мод Caveman2Cosmos, как видно из названия, является симулятором цивилизации на всех этапах ее развития от жизни пещерных людей до космической экспансии. Как переводчик, изучивший множество путеводителей и стратогем от разработчиков и сторонних авторов, я с немалым удивлением заметил почти полное отсутствие гайдов по освоению космоса, тогда как по древним эпохам их более чем достаточно. А между тем, космическая экспансия занимает всю вторую половину игры в сингл-плее, всего 6 эпох! Для новичков эта тема с непривычки может показаться довольно запутанной частью геймплея, поскольку ничего подобного не предусматривалось в оригинальной Civilization 4 BtS. Это побудило меня написать и встроить в Цивилопедию данное руководство и пособие для начинающих игроков и неопытных цивилизаторов.[PARAGRAPH:1][TAB]Перед тем, как перейти непосредственно к главной теме, нужно прояснить несколько базовых моментов. Изначально игра Civilization4 не была задумана для подобных модификаций, как С2С, а ее движок устарел еще задолго до появления данного мода. При разработке С2С мододелы, конечно же, предполагали внести в игровой процесс и освоение галактических просторов. Но вот загвоздка: как это можно осуществить на практике? В свое время Сид Мейер, отец игровой серии Civilization, выпустил несколько дополнений на тему покорения системы Альфа Центавра. По сути, это был просто независимый сценарий на отдельной карте. Игроки уже по умолчанию начинали партию с готовым набором технологий будущего и соответствующих построек, ресурсов и юнитов. Однако сама идея мода Caveman2Cosmos предполагает развитие от каменных топоров до звездолетов, т.е. стартовать на бренной Земле, а уж потом с нее совершать рывок к другим мирам. Что же в таком случае делать? Устаревший движок четвертой Цивилизации не позволяет ни играть на двух и более картах, ни экспортировать сохранения и профили игрока в другие сценарии. И разработчики мода нашли поистине соломоново решение: создать набор громадных карт, разделенных на множество секций - Земля, ближний космос, Луна, планеты Солнечной Системы, дальний космос, Млечный Путь, Местное Скопление и далее вплоть до окраин видимой Вселенной. Пока все игроки не развились до космических технологий, они не могут покинуть стартовый земной сектор. Они не способны даже увидеть что-либо за «краем Земли». Затем, по мере развития технологий, появляется возможность разведать и освоить сначала ближние окрестности родной планеты, затем все дальше углубляться в космос. Об этом пойдет разговор ниже, а пока отметим, насколько элегантно смогли выйти из положения разработчики этого мода, обойдя ограничения движка. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](1) Что нужно для космической экспансии?[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Прежде всего следует обзавестись подборкой качественных космических карт. Желательные для вас характеристики - это огромный размер, где с простором разместятся 20-24 живых и компьютерных игроков, наличие всех предусмотренных в моде секций и типов местности, и соответствующих им ресурсов. Перед началом игры следует отключить все легко достижимые виды победы, вроде [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Культурной[COLOR_REVERT] - иначе партия закончится еще до того, как вы запустите первый искусственный спутник. Наилучшие карты, актуальные всем последним версиям мода, можно поискать у разработчиков С2С на их форуме на "civfanatics.com". Карты от [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Snofru[COLOR_REVERT], думаю, отвечают практически всем заявленным критериям. Оптимальная скорость игры для этого будет «Марафон» и, полагаю, «Улитка», но конечный выбор всегда остается за игроком.[PARAGRAPH:1]Итак, вы определились с картой, выбрали себе цивилизацию по вкусу, установили набор правил для одиночной кампании и загрузились. Вы начнете игру в [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Доисторической эпохе[COLOR_REVERT], как обычно, в окружении привычных лесов и степей на девственной Земле. Долгие сотни и тысячи ходов вас не будут занимать проблемы покорения космоса. Первые шесть эпох, от [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Каменного века[COLOR_REVERT] до конца [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Промышленной эпохи[COLOR_REVERT] вы будете развиваться в обычном для цивилизаторов режиме: разведывать окрестности, бороться за доступ к ресурсам, воевать, торговать, строить новые города. Поворотный момент настанет, когда вы основательно разовьетесь и вступите в [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Ядерную эру[COLOR_REVERT], где можно изучить группу базовых технологий, которые дадут вам возможность сделать первые робкие шаги за пределы родной планеты - пока еще в околоземном пространстве. Об этом пойдет разговор в одном из разделов дальше по тексту руководства.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](2) Справка об игровых эпохах.[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]Как мы знаем, всего в актуальных версиях Caveman2Cosmos предусмотрено целых 13 эпох и более 1000 технологий в древе исследований. Трудно не согласиться, что это предполагает очень длительную по времени партию. Каждая эпоха характеризуется своими особенностями геймплея. Так, в [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Доисторическую эпоху[COLOR_REVERT] игроки располагают одним небольшим поселением и большая часть времени тратится на охоту на разнообразную дичь и одомашнивание животных. Далее, начиная с эпохи [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Древнего мира[COLOR_REVERT] вплоть до середины [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Информационной эпохи[COLOR_REVERT], игра похожа на классическую Civ4 BtS. Наконец, последние 5-6 эпох вы львиную долю времени будете посвящать разведке все новых и новых секторов космической части карты и постепенному их освоению. Игровой процесс будет все больше походить на то, что было Альфе Центавра и подобных ей дополнениях. Чем характеризуется каждая эра во второй половине игры, если говорить вкратце? Для этого предоставим слово одному из разработчиков, который и занимался «космической составляющей» С2С.[PARAGRAPH:1]Вот, что пишет [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT] относительно интересующих нас эпох, а именно Ядерной, Информационной, Нанотеха, Трансгуманистической, Галактической, Космической и Трансцендентной: «Ядерная эра - это стадия, с которой начинается космическая эра. Эпоха длится примерно с 1914 по 1989 год, от Первой мировой войны до конца холодной войны. Формально космическая эра начинается, когда вы исследуете спутники». К концу этой эпохи, как указывают разработчики, «вы развиваетесь до первых космических станций и исследовании ближайших окрестностей Земли». Далее, указывает [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT], «Информационная эра примерно соответствует периодам с 1990 по 2050 год... Вы получите свою первую межпланетную единицу, Межпланетный зонд... в начале информационной эры. Межпланетные зонды могут осуществить начальные исследования Меркурия, Венеры, Марса, Юпитера, Сатурна, Урана и Нептуна... Вы можете исследовать поверхности астероидов и объекты пояса Койпера, Внутреннюю Солнечную систему, Внешнюю Солнечную систему, Титан и Европу, а также объекты Транснептунового пространства...» На данном этапе игрок может лишь разведывать окрестности Солнечной системы, отправлять зонды и межпланетные станции, строить аванпосты и временные базы на поверхности Луны, но не более того. Для начала вам понадобится тяжелая ракета. Летите на ней на заранее отстроенную вами космическую станцию 3-го уровня. Теперь, оказывается, вам доступна новая миссия: улучшение до «Лунного поселенца»! Теперь берем этого поселенца и летим на любой понравившийся вам участок на окололунной орбите и стройте там свой первый город. Обратите внимание: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Лунный поселенец[COLOR_REVERT] может строить города только на орбите Луны, но не на ее поверхности. Эту возможность вы обретете чуть позже. Открыв панель строительства в первом вашем внеземном городе, вы обнаружите, что там нет ни одной земной постройки в общем списке (кроме храмов и соборов), зато есть множество новых зданий, недоступных на Земле, вроде «Орбитальной тюрьмы», «Арены нуль-гравитации», «Щиты из аэрогеля» и «Орбитальный телескоп». Последний дает вам от 800 до 1500 [ICON_RESEARCH] для научных исследований. Вообще, на будущее: многие космические, лунные, марсианские и инопланетные здания дают существенно большие бонусы, чем любые земные строения. Они дают существенный прирост к вашим научным исследованиям. Чем больше вы строите в космосе, тем быстрее вы изучаете все новые и новые технологии в поздней игре. Это крайне важно, ведь если вы отстанете в науке от конкурентов, то в дальнейшем оно только закрепится, что чревато вашим поражением в партии. Изолированные на Земле цивилизации, так и не вышедшие в космос, будут стерты более расторопными соперниками.[PARAGRAPH:1]Следующие важные технологии - это [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Колонизация Луны[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Лунный туризм[COLOR_REVERT] и [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Лунная промышленность[COLOR_REVERT]. Первая даст вам возможность создавать [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Лунных колонистов[COLOR_REVERT], корабли снабжения и массу лунных построек. Вторая технология сделает ваши колонии высокодоходными, а не убыточными, как раньше. Наконец, третья технология, исходя из названия, даст вам возможность строить на Луне фабрики, шахты и перерабатывающие комплексы, а также первые лунные юниты: пехотинца и рабочий комбайн для прокладки трасс и рытья шахт. Изучив «Колонизацию Луны», отправляйте тяжелую ракету на окололунную ОКС 3-го уровня, где нужно обновить ее до [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Лунного колониста[COLOR_REVERT]. В отличие от поселенца колонист умеет передвигаться по лунной поверхности, поэтому отправляем последнего к пункту назначения. Помните совет выше о необходимости заранее «застолбить» территорию на Луне? Теперь настало время обживаться. Отправьте колониста на любую клетку с отстроенной заставой или жилым комплексом - участок должен быть окрашен в цвета вашей цивилизации. Как только достигнете нужной клетки, у колониста появится новая команда «Строить город». Щелкаете по этой клавише - поздравляем вас с первым успешно основанным городом на Луне![PARAGRAPH:1]Однако когда вы открываете панель строительства нового города, вы понимаете, что он практически пуст, убыточен и почти не растет. Для решения этой проблемы нужно снарядить несколько [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Кораблей снабжения[COLOR_REVERT] и отправить их к лунному городу, затем обменять их на одну из четырех построек: «Солнечные панели», «Лунный склад», «Лунную цистерну» и «Хранилище удобрений». Первая даст вам электроэнергию, а последние три - снабдят некоторыми ресурсами и продовольствием. Затем вы строите поблизости карьер, бетономешалку, стеклозавод - все это даст вам доступ к теплицам и оранжереям, которые в свою очередь, поставят продовольствие колонистам. Затем с помощью корабля снабжения соберите первый рабочий комбайн и соедините ваш первый город с окрестными шахтами и карьерами сеткой грунтовых дорог. Позже вы точно так же соедините первый лунный город с последующими.[PARAGRAPH:1]Обосновавшись как следует на Луне, настало время обратить свои взоры на другие миры. Нас интересуют, конечно же, Марс и Венера. Для этого нам потребуются технологии планетарной колонизации, в особенности [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Инопланетная добыча[COLOR_REVERT]. На этом этапе технологического развития вам уже должен быть доступен новый вид колониста - [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Планетарный поселенец[COLOR_REVERT]. Получить его можно опять же - обновив до него тяжелую ракету на ОКС 3-го уровня. В отличие от лунного коллеги он может строить города на венерианской и марсианской поверхности. Куда предпочтительнее лететь, на Венеру или на Марс? В этой эпохе вам доступно сравнительно немного венерианских построек и улучшений, хотя можно уже создавать венерианских рабочих и колонистов, изучив [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Сверхзвуковые рельсы[COLOR_REVERT] и [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Инопланетную промышленность[COLOR_REVERT], соответственно. Поселения на Венере до эпохи [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Трангуманизма[COLOR_REVERT] будут расти очень медленно, что неудивительно для такой адски жаркой планеты с плотной ядовитой атмосферой. Все же я бы рекомендовал вам основать парочку поселений на Венере уже на данном этапе, чтобы застолбить лучшие территории. Главной же целью после Луны для нас станет Марс. Его колонизация проходит почти по той же схеме, что и Луны: создаете планетарного поселенца на ОКС и отправляете его к Красной планете. Первый город рекомендую ставить в месте наибольшей концентрации ресурсов, вроде [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]марсианской черники[COLOR_REVERT] и [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]сухого льда[COLOR_REVERT], так, чтобы городской радиус охватил примерно равное количество равнинных и холмистых клеток. Фактически первый марсианский город будет вашей ресурсодобывающей базой. К тому времени, когда разрастется ваш первый город на Марсе, вы построите первый космопорт на лунной орбите. С этого времени вы уже можете создавать напрямую планетарных поселенцев, минуя стадию отправки тяжелой ракеты с Земли к Луне. Это заметно ускорит вашу экспансию. Для начала вам будет достаточно 2-3 городов на Марсе, но позже их желательно увеличить до шести, т.к. в конце следующей эпохи вам понадобится 6 специфических марсианских построек для доступа к особому Чуду - «Экономике Солнечной системы». В дальнейшем города на Венере и Марсе сами смогут снаряжать поселенцев, рабочих и солдат для охраны ваших баз. С изучением технологии [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Андроиды[COLOR_REVERT] вы сможете создавать специальных работников для Луны. Они, как и марсианские и венерианские рабочие умеют в отличие от комбайнов строить линии для поездов маглев и соединять друг с другом города и с месторождениями ценных ресурсов. Солнечные панели вне городов дадут вам [ICON_PRODUCTION] и [ICON_GOLD], а теплицы обеспечат колонистов запасами пищи. Еще в эпохе [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Нанотеха[COLOR_REVERT] после изучения соответствующей технологии вы можете строить более продвинутые версии солнечных парусников, способные работать в отдаленных уголках Солнечной системы. Они вам понадобятся в следующей эпохе, когда вы будете обживаться в окрестностях планет-гигантов и на орбите Плутона.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H2](6) Синергия развития.[\H2][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][TAB]После эры [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Нанотеха[COLOR_REVERT] следует еще четыре эпохи технологического развития: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Трансгуманистическая[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Галактическая[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Космическая[COLOR_REVERT] и [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Трансцендентная[COLOR_REVERT]. Каждая из этих будущих эпох характеризуется экспонентным развитием вашей цивилизации от однопланетной к многопланетной, с последовательным освоением всей Солнечной системы, затем галактики Млечный путь, соседних галактик и, наконец, всей Мультивселенной. Мы не будем подробно останавливаться на этих эпохах в текущем разборе, поскольку освоение Галактики проходит по тем же алгоритмам, что и Луны, Марса и дальних планет Солнечной системы (хотя в них есть свои небольшие нюансы). Сначала вы изучаете технологии, дающие доступ ко все более продвинутым версиям разведывательных зондов и переселенческих звездолетов, затем вы разведываете дальние сектора космоса, отправляете первых колонистов, основываете первые города, соединяете их между собой вплоть до объединения оных в единую галактическую торговую и промышленную империю. В данном руководстве мы показали, как шаг за шагом можно развиваться за пределами Земли и заселять другие планеты. Однако это недостаточные условия для дальнейшей экспансии за пределами Солнечной системы. Пока вы экономически не объедините разрозненное хозяйство каждой колонии и планеты в единую систему, вы не сможете двигаться дальше. Так было задумано мододелами, что лишь мегацивилизация, объединившая в себе экономический потенциал Земли, Луны, Венеры, Марса и пр. планет, будет иметь достаточно сил и средств, чтобы колонизировать ту же Альфу Центавра. Это было реализовано в игре в виде так называемых особых Чудес, доступных в конце каждой из пяти последних эпох, начиная с [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Нанотеха[COLOR_REVERT]. Вот эти специальные Малые Чудеса: «Лунная экономика», «Экономика Солнечной системы», «Галактическая экономика», «Метагалактическая экономика» и «Экономика Вселенной». Не построив хотя бы одно из перечисленных Чудес, вы не сможете в дальнейшем эффективно осваивать следующие сектора космоса и застрянете на текущем этапе развития. Для понимания приведем только один наглядный пример: «Лунная экономика» открывает доступ к орбитальным мегаструктурам, вроде «Цилиндра О'Нила». Эти здания можно сооружать как на лунной орбите, так и в районе Пояса Койпера в эру [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Трансчеловека[COLOR_REVERT]. В свою очередь, без «Цилиндров О'Нила» невозможно строительство целой ветки зданий, с помощью которых можно снарядить межзвездные зонды и переселенческие звездолеты и выйти на галактические просторы. Таким образом, без «Лунной экономики» и «Экономики Солнечной системы» вы не сможете продвинуться дальше Пояса Койпера, а без «Галактической экономики» вам заказана дорога в Туманность Андромеды и др. отдаленные сектора. Это усложняет колонизацию, но делает игровой процесс более интересным и глубоким. Важность этих Малых Чудес трудно переоценить. Попробуем на примере «Лунной экономики» разобраться, что нужно для их строительства и что на это дает в целом.[PARAGRAPH:1]«Лунная экономика» и остальные 4 подобных ей Малых Чуда требуют наличие целой группы зданий, часть которых нужно построить на Земле, а оставшиеся - на лунной орбите и самой Луне. Невыполнение хотя бы одного пункта из общего списка делает недоступным это Чудо для строительства. Данное правило работает на все пять Чудес - различаются лишь требования по каждому конкретному из них. Подробности следует смотреть в соответствующей статье в Цивилопедии, а пока что разберемся с базисом, взяв для примера «Лунную экономику». Вот, что нужно вам построить и иметь в наличии для доступа к этому особому Чуду:[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Орбитальный завод (2 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Грузовой космопорт (4 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Орбитальная энергостанция (6 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Коммерческий космопорт (11 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Астероидная шахта (2 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Магнитная рампа (4 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Окололунная колония (6 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Лунная база (6 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Лунный космопорт (2 шт.);[PARAGRAPH:1][ICON_BULLET] Лунный сборочный цех (2 шт.).[PARAGRAPH:1]Наряду с перечисленными выше постройками вам нужно будет изучить технологию [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Торговля с Луной[COLOR_REVERT] в самом конце эры нанотехнологий и обзавестись следующими товарами: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]фотонные панели[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]экзоскелеты[COLOR_REVERT] и [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]метаматериалы[COLOR_REVERT]. Строится это Чудо на Земле вопреки своему названию. Теперь разберемся с цифрами выше, напротив названия каждой постройки. Они обозначают общее количество, которое нужно построить вашей цивилизации. Например, вам нужно одиннадцать коммерческих космопортов, по одному на каждый город. Это означает и другое: Вам необходимо, минимум, шесть городов на Луне и еще столько же на лунной орбите, поскольку именно столько требуется «Лунных баз» и «Окололунных колоний». Вы уже понимаете масштаб работы, не так ли? Может возникнуть заминка с астероидными шахтами, т.к. нужных клеток с астероидами может и не оказаться на лунной орбите. В этом случае вам придется захватить и отбуксировать парочку космических булыжников при помощи солнечных парусников, о чем уже был разговор в 4-ом параграфе «Форпосты и их значение». Как только все требования из списка будут выполнены, можете приступать к строительству Чуда. По его завершению в каждом ваше городе появится особое здание-эффект. Оно разблокирует вам в последующей эпохе строительство следующих зданий: «Небесное Око» и «Цилиндр О'Нила», которое дает начало линейке из полутора десятка зданий, нужных для колонизации Млечного пути, о чем упоминалось выше.[PARAGRAPH:1]Точно по такому же принципу строятся оставшиеся четыре особых Чуда в последующих эпохах. Важно внимательно изучать список требований в Цивилопедии и загодя готовить соответствующие здания или ресурсы. Тогда получение этих Чудес и связанных с ними эффектов не составит для вас особой сложности и сверхусилий.[PARAGRAPH:2]На этой ноте я завершаю свою обзорную статью, посвященную основам космической колонизации. Отдельное спасибо [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]Pepper2000[COLOR_REVERT] и остальным разработчикам этого замечательного мода для Civilization IV, а также всем, кто способствовал развитию этого проекта и его коммьюнити. Надеюсь, что это руководство поможет освоиться новичкам в запутанных дебрях мода и космической экспансии и получить в итоге увлекательную и комфортную игру.

TEXT.English: [H1]Beginner's Guide to One City Challenge (OCC)[\H1][PARAGRAPH:1]- by [BOLD]Greencardman[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Having played the One City Challenge a few times now I've realized that its one of the most exciting ways to play Civ IV, so I decided to write a short article to get people interested.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]For those of you who are unfamiliar with it, the One City Challenge (or OCC for short) limits the human player to only one city. The computer players can (and do) build as many cities as they want. Sound hard? Well maybe... The good news is the limits on two national wonders per city are lifted, as are the limits on wonders that require a certain number of building as prerequisites (except monasteries for some reason).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Starting The Game[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To begin a One City Challenge game you need to go to the custom game menu and check the box marked One City Challenge. Note: while the descriptive text says one city at a time, this is misleading, its one city forever. You can't switch cities even if you capture a nice one from a rival, and cities that culture flip automatically get razed. So be sure you start in a good place, because that's the one and only city you're going to get![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Maps:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Since resources are spread out more on larger maps, they're naturally harder to play a OCC game on. If you're feeling brave, go right ahead, but I usually start on a Tiny Pangaea map with 3 Civs. It guarantees you a few good resources on your start.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Victory Conditions:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It will probably be a good idea to change the normal victory conditions. A culture win is impossible for a human player on an OCC game, so I usually uncheck that box (note to Firaxis, might want to change that). Also, I usually uncheck the Time and Diplomatic victories as well, since the AI players can expand, they usually gain more points than the human player with one city can. [BOLD]Update:[\BOLD] if you want to play with the Permanent Alliance option on, it allows more variety in an OCC game. Because you are permanently allied with another player, the Cultural victory option becomes available (3 cities with legendary culture) and the Diplomatic and Time victories also become more easily attainable. Its your game, have fun with it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Civs:[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose your Civ wisely, because it makes a big difference in this game! As will be mentioned later, health, wonders and great people are key aspects to an OCC game, so I usually pick a Civ with combinations that will help me out in those areas (expansive, philosophical, industrious.) I usually forgo a financial Civ because cottage spamming isn't really a viable option for this game, you just don't have the space.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]The Early Game[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Probably the most important part of the game for an OCC player is the early game, because it determines how many wonders will be built, and how quickly Great People will start accumulating. But before we move into too many aspects of the early game, I'd like to cover the key game elements to winning the OCC game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Key Game Elements[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There are three key areas an OCC player needs to pay attention to in order to become a significant threat to the AI: health, wonders, and great people.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Health:[\BOLD] probably the most important aspect to an OCC game, it determines how large your city can grow. In most OCC games, city size is limited only by health (we'll get into why happiness isn't a problem later). So be sure you maximize your chances for a healthy city! This means moving next to fresh water (+2 health) if you can, and away from jungles and towards forests. Also, one health resource is probably more important than two or more happiness resources, so if you have a choice, chose the health resources. Of course any resources are good, since you can always trade them away for gold, and sometimes for health resources, but be careful, the AI is stingy! The only exception to this is Flood Plains, they provide enough food to give you some specialists.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Wonders:[\BOLD] another very important tool in the OCC arsenal (I've always wanted to say that.) Along with their usual benefits, wonders also work at constantly expanding your cultural borders, thereby giving you more territory, and probably more resources. But their most important role is providing the ever important GPP (Great People Points) that keep you ahead of the AI.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Which leads us to great people, that last key element of an OCC game. I use all forms, but generally I find Great Engineers and Great Prophets to be the most important, especially in the early game. Great Scientists are useful for the Academy they give you, and also for discovering techs, while Great Artists keep your borders expanding constantly, allowing you to take over neighboring resources. Occasionally I get a Great Merchant, but since I play on a small map, they're not too useful, especially in large numbers. Others, however, find them to be incredibly useful, you can read their strategies in later posts.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Starting Location and Resources[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Now that we've covered some key elements, lets get back to starting our game. To begin with, check out your starting location. Sometimes I keep my settler stationary and explore with my scout to try and find a better area. In an OCC game, its not really what's in your city radius as what's just outside of it. Because your culture expands fairly quickly, you generally get access to resources rather fast. But at some point your borders slow down or the AI builds next to you, which means you should start your city with enough resources 6 to 7 squares away in order to ensure early game access to them. Anything outside of that means you'll have to wait a bit longer for your culture to catch up. So if you have your choice, move closer to health resources and away from happiness ones.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]On a related note, I should mention two other resources that are vitally important to the OCC win: marble and stone. Since they increase wonder production, they're even worth moving away from a health resource to get. Especially if you can get to within 4 or less squares right away. This will allow you to punch a worker out as quickly as possible, by which time your borders will expand enough to envelop the resource, and you can hook it up and start producing wonders.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To end the resource discussion, remember that unless you start on the coast you'll never be able to produce workboats to get access to sea-based resources (and the health they provide.) Its very frustrating to see your borders expand to the open ocean, and not be able to do anything about it. So if you notice an abundance of water resources, you may want to start on the coast.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Early Game Tech and Production[\BOLD][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Since wonders are an important part of an OCC game, I usually beeline for techs that give me wonders. A nice thing about the game is that you don't have to worry about building any settlers! So while the AI is building theirs, you can be starting your first wonder. Usually I build a warrior until the my city reaches a size two, then I switch to a worker, and then finish the warrior and start my first wonder.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Religion:[\BOLD] I generally don't bother with starting a religion.
